title: Love this! This app saved my Galaxy SIII
comment: This app saved me from returning my Galaxy SIII. Recently I bought the Galaxy SIII (switched from iPhone 4) and to my horror I found that Android does not have Corporate Exchange contact search. I have used this feature like crazy - I never used to save my colleagues phone numbers in my device since they are available in exchange and could pulled up easily using iPhone contact search.   At one point I thought of returning the phone I like so much. After some searching I found this app and it is a huge help. Now I can search my office directory without any issues. Thank you!

title: Beauty!
comment: I had an issue while trying to retrieve an email address on my Sony ericsson MT11i (Xperia Neov), the issue was, I was able to get only 20 results for the first name which i typed into the search field and there was no other way to go to the next page to retrieve additional names associated with the first name (for ex: if I had to search for Martin Zoey on my company directory and I was not aware of the last name <in this case Zoey> I would just type Martin and the results were limited to only 20 email address, Since Zoey is the last alphabet in English, it would have been buried in 3rd or 4th page of the search results and there was no way to go to that sheet as the limitation in xperia neo v only allowed the first 20 results to be displayed) (Ridiculous)!! ! However, this application helped in a big way as it was able to get all the results for the targeted first name, which in turn helped me select the right individual! Amazing application!! a must have for anyone out there having issues with corporate directory a.k.a GAL! well done Vivek, Kudos to you and the team for working on this addon and over the top of it, to have made given it free!!

comment: Installed. Linked to Exchange server. Opened up native email app on phone. Composed an email. Clicked in the "To" field. Typed in first couple letters of corporate contact. She appeared. Sent email. Anything else? Look, I know people get a little miffed when their "Other and Apple product" doesn't do everything their telepathic brain waves tell it to do, but that is the game people. Anything non-Apple just takes a little higher IQ to do some tinkering around. Suck it up and figure it out.

title: Perfect Solution to my challenge
comment: This works PERFECTLY for what I needed it for. I need to have active sync pointed to one client's exchange server, but still have access to an address book on another client's server. This app may seem "pointless" if you don't need it, but if you are in my situation, this app is dead-on, a direct hit.
